alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 13 at 2:32PM CST until November 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE ACROSS FAR SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS, FOR THE FRENCHMAN BASIN ZONE 210... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * TIMING...Until 5 PM MDT Monday * TEMPERATURES...In the 60s. * WIND...From the south at 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
